p: During the evaluation period, one timeliness indicator had good performance and one had moderate performance (Table 2). Approximately 25% of samples were not received or tested within the expected time period. 86.3% of the samples collected in Lusaka Province were received within the expected time period, whereas only 67.3% of the samples collected in the Copperbelt Province met the expected timeline. No significant difference in the proportion of samples positive for influenza was observed between the sites situated in Lusaka (9.0% 650/7207) and Ndola (8.1%; 244/3005) ( p = 0.1429). The mean score for data timeliness was 2.5 (moderate to good performance) (Table 1).
